issue.title: ftp: new flag to limit the number of parallel connections

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

body:
You should be able to limit the number of ftp connections to 2 with with `--checkers 1` and `--transfers 1`.

Those control rclone concurrency.  It should really say that in the ftp and the sftp documentation though!

At least the "ls" command doesn't seem respect --checkers 1 and --transfers 1.

I did use --transfers 1 in the first place (the backup stage), it worked.
But some restic commands like ls/check/... use ls.

Ah, you are right... the restic backend won't be using `--checkers` or `--transfers` to limit its concurrency.

It really should though as should the other `serve` backends, `serve http`, `serve webdav`.

My preferred way of doing this is with the [TokenDispenser](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/lib/pacer/tokens.go) which is a very thin wrapper about a buffered channel.

You could add `Checkers` and `Transfers` public methods to the [Server struct](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/cmd/serve/httplib/httplib.go#L98), initialise them in `NewServer`, then in each http method ([all the functions referenced here](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/cmd/serve/restic/restic.go#L203)) you could add either

```go
s.srv.Checkers.Get()
defer s.srv.Checkers.Put()
```

or

```go
s.srv.Transfers.Get()
defer s.srv.Transfers.Put()
```
depending on whether the action puts or gets a file (it is a transfer) or anything else (it is a check).

Hm, `rclone ls ftp:` fails for me in the described way:

    530 Sorry, the maximum number of clients (1) from your host are already connected.

But `rclone --checkers 1 --transfers 1 ls ftp:` does help and all files are displayed.

(rclone v1.44)

I plan to use that rclone destination with restic - is there a work-around to limit the number of connections in that scenario? For example via a key in `~/.config/rclone/rclone.conf` or an environment variable?

So far, I've only been able to limit rclone/restic to a max of 2 connections.

```
export RCLONE_CHECKERS=1
export RCLONE_TRANSFERS=1
/usr/local/bin/restic -o rclone.connections=2 ...
```

> So far, I've only been able to limit rclone/restic to a max of 2 connections.
> 
> ```
> export RCLONE_CHECKERS=1
> export RCLONE_TRANSFERS=1
> /usr/local/bin/restic -o rclone.connections=2 ...
> ```

Do you want to warm up your pull request to add a token dispenser with a flag to control the concurrency?
I don't have time for this right now.

(meanwhile I found `RCLONE_*` in the rclone manual, but I was still missing the `-o rclone.connections=...` restic option in my last experiments).

Unfortunately, this only works for the init/backup/forget restic commands - and not for prune. With prune I still get a bunch of `530 Sorry, the maximum number of clients (1) from your host are already connected`  messages (I use `rclone.connections=1` because the server really enforces a limit of 1 connection).

However, the restic prune still finishes with success:

    [..]
    finding old index files
    saved new indexes as [e4218bc4]
    remove 8 old index files
    [0:00] 100.00%  8 / 8 packs deleted
    done

Try this - I added an `--ftp-concurrency` flag.  You can also put `concurrency = 1` in your ftp remote config.

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.46.0-021-gc21543bb-fix-2166-ftp-concurrency-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.47

issue.title: rclone parallel uploads

labels.name: state: need direction
labels.description: need key decisions or input from core developers

issue.body:
<!--

  1. Fill out the issue template below - not doing so needs a good reason.
  2. Use the forum if you have a question rather than a bug or feature request.

The forum is at: https://forum.restic.net

The forum is a better place for questions about restic or general suggestions
and topics, e.g. usage or documentation questions! This issue tracker is mainly
for tracking bugs and feature requests directly relating to the development of
the software itself, rather than the project.

Thanks for understanding, and for contributing to the project!

-->


Output of `restic version`
--------------------------
restic 0.9.4 (v0.9.4-37-g7b8d1dc0) compiled with go1.11.4 on linux/arm64

<!--
Please add the version of restic you're currently using here, this helps us
later to see what has changed in restic when we revisit this issue after some
time.
-->

What should restic do differently? Which functionality do you think we should add?
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
uploading more files in parallel through rclone.



What are you trying to do?
--------------------------

restic uploads 4 files in parallel through rclone. Due to some weird limitations on the remote storage, they only allow 500kb speed or so per file uploaded, however, if we increase the number of parallels connections we can use more bandwidth and reduce backup time (tested and confirmed with rclone sync).

Example of current rclone uploads to Jotta Cloud (just as an example, it can be with oneDrive, hubic, opendrive, b2, etc...) command used:

`restic  backup /srv/dev-disk-by-label-DATAdroid  --exclude-file=/root/filter.restic -v -v  --repo rclone:oDroid-Jotta:/restic/dataDroid -o rclone.connections="10"   -o rclone.args="serve restic --stdio --rc --rc-addr localhost:5582 --rc-no-auth --config /root/.config/rclone/rclone.conf --log-file /mnt/cache/log/restic.jotta -v --transfers 10 --stats=20s"`

achieving the following output...

```
Transferred:        1.307G / 1.316 GBytes, 99%, 1.616 MBytes/s, ETA 5s
Errors:                 0
Checks:                 0 / 0, -
Transferred:          275 / 279, 99%
Elapsed time:    13m48.1s
Transferring:
 *     data/45/45a7f45c3de30be968fb3887a4f3316f:  7% /4.005M, 163.955k/s, 23s
 *     data/4a/4a9a4b16f1a9668a9089f9602d2c731e: 27% /4.593M, 451.721k/s, 6s
 *     data/97/97965e0121dcc76f0b070a9b9876f7d4: 97% /4.146M, 565.974k/s, 0s
 *     data/e4/e4562dd9205e1dfd2c0b293fa66dfc4b: 54% /4.599M, 520.954k/s, 4s
```


how it should be...

as many files as the parameter rclone.connections (10 in this command), or a new parameter, is set up, so then we could be uploading 10 files (instead of our current 4, the default by rclone with no modifiers) reducing the time of the backups.

I have seen in the code (restic/internal/backend/rclone/config.go), we can configure the number of connections, however, that does not change the number of uploads through rclone.

`Connections uint option:"connections" help:"set a limit for the number of concurrent connections (default: 5)"`

and in 

```
func NewConfig() Config {
        return Config{
                Connections: 5,
        }
}
```
Nevertheless, I guess above configurations are more about the number of connections to rclone rather than the amount of files to be uploaded in parallel. am I right?


Did restic help you or made you happy in any way?
-------------------------------------------------
I am starting to use this great piece of software and I guess that can help me to keep my data safe, I would really like the idea of having a software fully customizable. Please, allow setting up a new parameter that will be the amount of parallels files to be uploaded. We can then extensively use more bandwidth uploading more files.

I have a lot of experience uploading backup to cloud storage providers, and is very annoying having enough bandwidth to upload 1Tb in less than 12hours and spend 3 days or more in doing so....
 
(1Tb of data to be uploaded to jotta through restic/rclone is taking 170hours).

Keep doing such a good stuff!!, you rock!

body:
This is also an issue for Webdav.

The server I need to connect to bans you if you use more than 1 connection at a time, with manual intervention required from the admin staff to reverse the ban, so using `--checkers` and `--transfers` won't work, as that can only limit you to 2 connections maximum.
